riddle: Oft I must strive with wind and wave, battle them both when under the sea. I feel out the bottom, a foreign land. In lying still, I am strong in the strife. If I fail in that, they are stronger than I, and wrenching me loose, soon put me to rout. They wish to capture what I must keep. I can master them both if my grip holds out, If the rocks bring succour and lend support, strength in the struggle. Ask me my name!
hint: What holds boats still in the sea?

riddle: Weight in my belly, Trees on my back, Nails in my ribs, Feet I do lack.
hint: What can sail the seven seas?

riddle: The wave, over a wave, a weird thing I saw, Through-wrought, and wonderful ornate: A wonder on the waves, water become bone.
hint: What object can make a hot drink cold?

riddle: What does man love more than life, Fear more than death or mortal strife, What the poor have, the rich require, And what contented men desire, What misers spend, and spendthrifts save, And all men carry to the grave?
hint: Is there anything guaranteed to man beyond the grave?

riddle: What gets wetter the more it dries?
hint: What do you use to dry off when wet?

riddle: Only one color, but not one size, Stuck at the bottom, yet easily flies, Present in sun but not in rain, doing no harm and feeling no pain. What am I?
hint: What follows behind you on sunny days?

riddle: What force and strength cannot get through, I with a gentle touch can do, And many in the streets would stand were I not a friend at hand.
hint: What tool allows man to enter a locked house?

riddle: In marble walls as white as milk, Lined with skin as soft as silk, Within a fountain crystal clear, A golden apple does appear. No doors are there to this stronghold, yet thieves break in and steal the gold.
hint: This is a popular breakfast food

riddle: Black we are, and much admired, men seek for us when tired. We tire the horses, but comfort man, Tell me this riddle if you can
hint: What is used to start fires?

riddle: Round like an apple, deep like a cup, yet all the King's horses cannot pull it up
hint: People often visit these to gather water

riddle: What comes once in a minute, twice in a moment, but never in a thousand years?
hint: What letter may be missing in a thousand years?

riddle: My life can be measured in hours, I serve by being devoured. Thin, I am quick - fat, I am slow. The wind is my foe - What am I?
hint: What do you blow out on your birthday?

riddle: Round she is, yet flat as a board. Altar of the Lupine Lords. Jewel on black velvet, pearl in the sea - Unchanged yet everchanging eternally. What am I?
hint: What is ever present in the night sky, sometimes even during the day?

riddle: To keep this you must first give it to another.
hint: It's something you give in a promise to keep trust.

riddle: The more I eat the larger I grow, but if I should ever drink I will die.
hint: It feeds on air but dies with water.

riddle: Two bodies have I, though together we are one. The more I stand still the faster I run.
hint: It measures time with sand but never moves itself.

riddle: I exist in the past, I am made in the present, but the future will never taint me.
hint: They are created now but only live in what has already happened.

riddle: What can run but never walks, has a mouth but never talks, has a head but never weeps, has a bed but never sleeps?
hint: It flows through lands, has a mouth and a bed, but no legs or voice.

riddle: The man who invented it doesn't want it. The man who bought it doesn't need it. The man who needs it doesn't know it. What is it?
hint: It's used after death, but never by the one who buys it.

riddle: No sooner spoken than broken. What is it?
hint: It vanishes the moment a word is said.

riddle: What turns everything around but does not move?
hint: It reflects you without changing place.

riddle: What goes up and down but never moves?
hint: You use it to change levels without it moving.

riddle: I speak without a mouth and hear without ears. I have no body, but I come alive with wind.
hint: You’ll find me in mountains and empty halls.

riddle: I rise each morning, set each night, Giving warmth as well as light. Center of our system, burning sphere, What bright object holds planets near?
hint: The source of all Earth’s energy.

riddle: What has keys, but no locks; space, but no room; and you can enter, but not go in?
hint: You use it to type, but it’s not a door.
